title: Large-Scale Scientific Inquiry Process Using Interactive Multimedia (Hypothesis–Experiment–Analysis–Conclusion)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic smartphone operation skills and elementary science knowledge (lab equipment usage, simple observation/measurement techniques, foundational variable control concepts)
context.additional_context: Learners primarily access online content via smartphones, sharing tablets or public digital equipment during in-person sessions. Science concepts should be explained through daily-life examples (e.g., gravity - measuring swing periods at playgrounds, photosynthesis - designing plant cultivation experiments) to enhance understanding. All activities must reflect the scientific inquiry process (hypothesis setting → variable-controlled experiment design → quantitative data analysis → evidence-based conclusions). Particularly emphasizes the use of measurement tools (thermometers, scales) and data recording (tables, graphs).

learning_goals: Through scenario-based formative assessments, learners explain principles of scientific phenomena (e.g., relationships between independent/dependent variables, hypothesis verification methods) with ≥80% accuracy.

Learners can select three science concepts (e.g., measuring photosynthesis efficiency, calculating gravitational acceleration, analyzing electrical circuit resistance) during a mid-term course (3 weeks), visually and auditorily represent them using multimedia materials (videos/infographics), and achieve an average score of 4 or higher on a 5-point scale from peer evaluations and instructor feedback. (Measurable evidence: mandatory variable control records, data visualization materials)

Learners can revise at least three core elements of educational scenarios (inquiry objectives, experimental activities, evidence-based assessments) over two weeks based on provided feedback (peer evaluations, instructor comments), and submit revised scenarios applying four or more items from a self-directed learning strategy checklist (goal resetting, experimental tool utilization, reflective journaling, etc.). (Reflecting experimental design improvements: variable redesign, measurement method enhancement)

resources: Public Institution Digital Equipment Rental Service
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
